questions.question_text: An enterprise interested in adapting COBIT components with related documentation such as inputs and outputs references should refer to:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In COBIT® 2019, the explicit process outcomes or process goals are replaced by the process practices themselves.

Ans C is correct
6.5.1 Performance Management of Organizational Structures, Page 40,
COBIT 2019 Framework Introduction and Methodology

questions.question_text: Which of the following aspects of organizational structure is MOST critical to ensure effective performance?

choices.B: Required resources are made available, allocated and used.
choices.A: Escalation procedures are defined and applied.
choices.C: A clearly understood and well-documented mandate is in place.

choices.B: Review change drivers to determine whether corresponding changes were successful.
choices.A: Evaluate performance measurements identified in the business case.
choices.C: Survey the satisfaction level of key business stakeholders.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Evaluate performance measurements identified in the business case.

questions.question_text: What is the BEST way to determine whether IT governance is achieving intended outcomes one year after implementation?

choices.B: COBIT 2019 Implementation Guide: Implementing and Optimizing an Information and Technology Governance Solution
choices.C: COBIT 2019 Design Guide: Designing an Information and Technology Governance Solution
choices.A: COBIT 2019 framework Governance and Management Objectives

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. COBIT 2019 framework Governance and Management Objectives

Selected Answer: A
COBIT® 2019 Framework: Governance and Management Objectives comprehensively describes the 40 core governance and management objectives, the processes contained therein, and other related components. This guide also references other standards and frameworks., page 19 COBIT-2019-Framework-Introduction-and-Methodology

Selected Answer: C
C. COBIT 2019 Design Guide: Designing an Information and Technology Governance Solution

comments.content: My apologies, the correct answer is A.

questions.question_text: Which of the following COBIT publications also references other standards and frameworks?

choices.A: A clearly defined I&T management structure
choices.B: An actionable strategy and governance system

questions.answer_description:
To create value, the enterprise must balance benefits, risk, and resources, and develop an actionable strategy and governance system.
Reference:
https://www.testpreptraining.com/tutorial/governance-system-principles/

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While all three elements (a clearly defined I&T management structure, an actionable strategy and governance system, and well-documented and monitored business processes) are important for effective I&T management, having an actionable strategy and governance system is the key driver for maximizing value from I&T. An actionable strategy provides a clear direction for how I&T will support the business objectives, and a governance system ensures that the strategy is implemented effectively, risks are managed, and value is realized. The governance system includes processes, roles, and responsibilities for decision-making and oversight, which are crucial for achieving I&T-related goals and delivering value to the organization.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST enables an enterprise to maximize value from the use of I&T?
